content:
• Friday, March 24, 2017

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: WFT +7.8%. FUEL +3.6%. PDLI +3.5%. XENE +3.3%. MIK +2.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: WING -3.0%. HK -1.7%. CRBP -1.7%. OPHT -1.6%. AAV-OLD -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 9 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: VXX +6.1%. UNG +5.1%. PSLV +2.3%. SLV +2.1%. SIVR +2.1%.
    • Top losers: URA -7.9%. TAN -3.7%. XLF -3.7%. REMX -3.4%. IJS -3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • THC

    Hospitals rally on Republican backpedal on health bill

    • Consistent with recent movement, hospital operators jump on the news that Republicans have postponed the vote on the American Health Care Act.
    • (THC +7.5%)(ACHC +5.9%)(CYH +9.8%)(HCA +3.4%)(LPNT +3.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 31 Comments
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy starts phase two exploration drilling off western Africa

    • Kosmos Energy (KOS +3.9%) maintains strong gains after announcing the start of the second phase of its multi-well exploration drilling program offshore of Mauritania and Senegal in western Africa.
    • The Atwood Achiever, an ultra-deepwater drillship on lease from Atwood Oceanics (ATW +0.3%), has launched operations on the first exploration well in the Yakaar prospect west of the company's earlier Teranga discovery.
    • KOS is partnering with BP in the area, where the companies plan three exploration wells for this year leading to a new liquefied natural gas hub.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 4 Comments
  • HGEN

    KaloBios raises additional $5.5M via debt financing; shares slip 23%

    • Pink sheet stock KaloBios (KBIO -23.3%) drops on increased volume, albeit on turnover of only 12,350 shares, on the heels of its announcement that it has raised an additional $5.5M from existing investors via an amendment to its term loan facility. The total principal amount of the loan is now $9.2M.
    • Proceeds will fund working capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • ANDV

    Tesoro, four other refiners downgraded at Credit Suisse

    • Tesoro (TSO -1.5%) is lower after Credit Suisse downgrades shares to Neutral from Outperform with a $93 price target, cut from $110, one of five refiners the firm downgrades as it says it does not want to chase relative valuation as refiners rebalance.
    • TheFly.com reports that Credit Suisse's longer term view of broader refining margins remains relatively muted, and TSO's business has a "more negative grey sky sensitivity" than some peers given higher California operational costs and a greater share of R&M income, despite progress on diversification and retail integration.
    • The firm also cuts Alon USA Energy (ALJ -3.5%), Delek US Holdings (DK -3.6%), Western Refining (WNR -1.3%) to Neutral from Outperform, and drops Calumet Specialty Products (CLMT -1.3%) to Underperform from Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread clears $250 for first time

    • Shares of Panera Bread (PNRA +1.1%) traded over $250 for the first time earlier today.
    • The restaurant stock is now about 8% short of the Street high price target of $270 set by both Cowen and Telsey Advisory. Panera trades at about 32.5X its 2017 earnings per share guidance.
    • Previously: Panera aims high with profit guidance and delivery target (Feb. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 1 Comment

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: FSNN +19%. COGT +18%. QUIK +13%. BCOV +12%. OTC:VLTC +11%.
    • Losers: ISNS -8%. VHC -7%. HMNY -7%. VNET -6%. IDSY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • PGHEF

    Pengrowth Energy to sell Bernadet Montney lands for C$92M

    • Pengrowth Energy (PGH +1.9%) after announcing last night that it agrees to sell its non-producing Montney lands at Bernadet in British Columbia to an undisclosed buyer for C$92M (US$68.8M).
    • PGH says the land has no associated production, cash flow and neither reserves or resources assigned to it in its year-end 2016 reserves report.
    • The Montney deal follows its C$180M sale of non-core assets in the Swan Hills area earlier this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 15 Comments
  • MDP

    Time getting closer to sale north of $20 - Bloomberg

    • A sale of the entire company is more likely than not, and a deal valuing the publisher at more than $20 per share could be reached as early as next week, according to the report.
    • Meredith (MDP +1%) and a group including Pamplona Capital remain in the running, as are at least two other suitors, including a publicly traded company.
    • TIME +0.8% to $19.40
    • Previously: NY Post: Meredith may be front-runner to acquire Time (March 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 7 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: GBR +40%. ERN +11%. ECR +6%. AXU +6%.
    • Losers: SXC -8%. KLDX -7%. SXCP -7%. SAEX -6%. GSV -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASPS

    Shorts press bets in Altisource Portfolio Solutions

    • According to shortside.com, shorts have been selling into the continuing rally in Altisource Portfolio Solutions (ASPS +3%), with a record 5.72M shares shorted as of yesterday - this as soaring borrowing rates (over 70%) suggest there's less and less available shares out there.
    • The stock has now regained nearly all of its mid-February, near-30%, post-earnings plunge.
    • Previously: Short squeeze building in Altisource Portfolio Solutions? (March 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 8 Comments
  • ALR

    Alere up 3% as investors anticipate improved prospects for favorable outcome with Abbott based on ruling by judge in different case

    • Money flow perks up in Alere (ALR +2.5%) on apparent increased optimism from investors that its squabble with would-be acquirer Abbott (ABT +0.1%) may end favorably.
    • Judge Leo Strine recently dissented (4-1)in a case involving a botched merger between Williams Co. and Energy Transfer Equity, saying the companies could have easily saved the combination by making a "modest amendment." The situation appears similar to the ABT/ALR dispute. Judge Sam Glasscock, who voted with the majority, is handling both cases.
    • Widener University professor and specialist in Delaware corporate law Larry Hamermesh doesn't see much carryover though, calling it a "stretch" to draw a conclusion from the Williams decision since the two cases and the related legal issues are different.
    • Abbott has been trying to back out of the $5.8B deal citing a "substantial loss in value" due to a range of problems at Alere.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold says strike ends at South Africa mine

    • Harmony Gold (HMY +3.6%) says the strike is over at its Kusasalethu mine in South Africa after losing 3-4 days of full production.
    • HMY says the strike was ended following discussions between its senior management and the leadership of the AMCU union.
    • The mine produces ~13% of HMY’s total 1M-1.1M oz./year in production and generates 10% of the company's total cash flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: HTGM +204%. ZAIS +44%. GBR +25%. CBIO +21%. OTC:VLTC +19%. RGLS +18%. COGT +17%. PLSE +15%. BCOV +15%. FUEL +14%.
    • Losers: XENE -53%. MDGS -27%. FINL -18%. VNCE -14%. GME -12%. ROSG-OLD -10%. SPWH -10%. COLL -10%. ITUS -10%. USCR -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • FINL

    Finish Line margins hit by promotions

    • FInish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) struggled to sell its products in Q4, leading to a margin-walloping increase in promotions to clear inventory.
    • Although management points to the clean inventory sheet, Susquehanna warns that it's clear that the company is losing more market share to Foot Locker (FL +0.1%) due in part to the product assortment.
    • Previously: Finish Line misses by $0.21, beats on revenue (March 24)
    • Previously: Finish Line lower post FQ4 results (March 24)
    • FINL is down 16.44% and traded as low as $12.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 3 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: SNAK +11%.
    • Losers: VNCE -12%. SPWH -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • RGLS

    Regulus perks up 20% on Chairman's stock purchase

    • Nano cap Regulus Therapeutics (RGLS +20%) is up on average volume. The jump in buying is being stoked by the disclosure that Chairman Stelios Papadopoulos recently acquired a 500K stake at an average price of ~$1.22.
    • The company's pipeline consists of HCV candidate RG-101, Alport syndrome candidate RG-012, diabetes candidate RG-125 and kidney disease candidate RGLS4326.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 6 Comments
  • USCR

    U.S. Concrete -10%; SunTrust out defending the stock

    • U.S. Concrete (USCR -10.4%) plunges 10% following this morning's news of the CFO's resignation and a sudden change in auditors, but TheFly.com reports SunTrust says shares should be bought on today's selloff.
    • Analyst Rohit Seth says that while the optics look bad, he confirmed with the company that the auditor change to Ernst & Young from Grant Thornton is unrelated to the CFO resignation.
    • Seth believes USCR's growth prospects remain intact, and recommends using today's weakness as a buying opportunity; the firm has a Buy rating and $90 price target on the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 5 Comments
  • DXCM

    Medicare clarifies criteria for coverage of DexCom's G5 CGM System; shares ahead 9%

    • DexCom (DXCM +9%) perks up on average volume in response to the publication of Medicare's criteria for covering the G5 Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) System, the only CGM device under this particular CMS code.
    • Eligible patients will have either Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes requiring multiple daily injections of insulin or the use of a continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion pump, have been using a home blood glucose monitor and performing frequent blood glucose monitoring testing and whose insulin treatment regimen requires frequent adjustment by the patient on the basis of CGM testing results. To qualify for reimbursement under this category, the system must be defined as therapeutic CGM (the G5 is the only current qualifier).
    • Previously: CMS OKs reimbursement for DexCom's CGM system (Jan. 13)
    • Source: The Fly
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • AYX

    Alteryx -4.6% in trading debut

    • Alteryx (NYSE:AYX) priced late yesterday for offer at $14 per share. Opening 23% over that level at $17.25, shares have at this point retraced near $16.45.
    • Specializing in self-service data analytics, Alteryx (founded 2010, $163M funding raised pre-IPO) recorded, for the 2016 term, $85.8M in revenues (vs. $53.8M Y/Y), a net loss of $24.3M (vs. $21.5M Y/Y) and an $86M accumulated deficit as of December 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • SNAK

    Inventure Foods pops after shedding some weight

    • Inventure Foods (SNAK +11.1%) shoots higher after the company announces an asset sale of $23M and tips a shareholder-friendly strategy moving ahead.
    • Shares of Inventure are still down 54% for the year.
    • Previously: Inventure Foods +10% after asset sale (March 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: HTGM +179%. RGLS +18%. ATOS +10%. AKER +10%. DXCM +9%.
    • Losers: XENE -50%. MDGS -27%. AEMD -9%. ADPT -9%. ROSG-OLD -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • T

    FBR: Telecom/media consolidation set to take off

    • The Trump administration is set to pave the way for a long-anticipated wave of consolidation in the telecom/media space, FBR says.
    • Most notably, the $85B combination of AT&T (T +0.2%) and Time Warner (TWX +0.3%) looks set to get its regulatory OK by the end of the year -- that after Trump had actively expressed skepticism about the deal during his presidential campaign and amid a well-covered feud with Time Warner news network CNN.
    • Analyst Barton Crockett drew other takeaways from a meeting with Michael Lazarus of Telecommunications Law Professionals, Bloomberg notes. Comcast (CMCSA +0.8%) may have a tougher time than Charter (CHTR +1%) when it comes to executing a wireless-company merger, due to its existing concentration of content and pipes.
    • Meanwhile, while investors in T-Mobile (TMUS +2.4%) and Sprint (S +0.7%) look ahead to a possible tie-up, that deal might never happen due to flexible options at T-Mobile. And a reinstatement of the UHF discount by the FCC could clear the way for a combination of Tribune Media (TRCO +0.4%) and Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 404 Comments
  • ET

    Energy Transfer's exit from Williams merger upheld by court

    • Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +1.7%) had the right to end its merger with Williams Cos. (WMB +1.2%), the Delaware Supreme Court ruled yesterday,
    • The ruling means that ETE does not have to fulfill its tie-up with WMB and can press forward with claims that its former takeover target owes a $1.5B breakup fee.
    • ETE did not violate the 2015 agreement to buy WMB by invoking a tax flaw or allowing buyer’s remorse to hinder efforts to rescue the combination, the court ruled.
    • WMB argues it suffered as much as $10B in damages from ETE’s decision to pull out of the deal and rejects ETE's claim that it is owed a breakup fee under the merger agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 61 Comments
  • TPCO

    Billionaire, chairman battling for control of Tronc

    • A feud over control of Tronc (TRNC +1.7%) is advancing quickly, as billionaire Patrick Soon-Shiong looks to be moving toward a controlling stake vs. Chairman Michael Ferro, and Oaktree Capital Management getting out of its stake.
    • Soon-Shiong was moved off Tronc's board and subsequently moved to pay $30M for HG Vora Capital's 5.5% stake. In a filing, the company noted that Oaktree surprisingly moved to sell its 10.3% stake back to Tronc for $15/share, with the protection of a payout if ownership changed within a year and the new owner paid a premium.
    • That move is seen as a counter by Ferro to Oaktree's earlier sale of $13.9M worth of shares to Soon-Shiong.
    • An amendment permits Ferro to buy up to 30% of Tronc's outstanding shares; Soon-Shiong is pressing for the same approval.
    • Tronc, the former Tribune Publishing, is the parent of the Los Angeles Times, the Chicago Tribune, and several other daily papers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • PGNX

    Data from mid-stage study of Progenics' prostate cancer imaging agent 1404 published in nuclear medicine journal

    • Results from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating Progenics Pharmaceuticals' (PGNX +1%) SPECT/CT imaging agent 1404 for visualizing prostate cancer has just been published in the Journal of Nuclear Medicine.
    • The data demonstrate the sensitivity of 1404 to detect prostate caner using both visual and semi-quantitative tumor-to-background (TBR) scores.
    • The company is currently assessing 1404 in a Phase 3 study in certain patients with low grade prostate cancer.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 3 Comments
  • ZNH

    China Southern higher again with American circling

    • China Southern (NYSE:ZNH) is up 6.50% on more talk that the company is poised to sell a stake to American Airlines Group.
    • Sources tell The Straights Times that the private placement investment will be around $200M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • HCLP

    Hi-Crush Partners +4% early after positive Barron's article

    • Hi-Crush Partners (HCLP +4%) opens with impressive gains after Barron's says shares could climb 50% in a year thanks to rising demand for fracking sand even with far fewer rigs in operation than a few years ago.
    • HCLP's 20% YTD selloff looks overdone, says Raymond James analyst J. Marshall Adkins, who estimates that 2017 sand volume will reach 60M tons vs. 55M tons in peak 2014 and possibly rising to 90M tons by next year.
    • For HCLP, it likely would mean a quick rebound in distributable cash flow and the return of investor distributions as soon as later this year, Barron's Jack Hough writes.
    • A WSJ article yesterday also noted the improving market for frac sand and how it is eroding some of the profits energy companies had retained since the end of the oil price bust.
    • Also: SLCA +4.2%, FMSA +6.3%, EMES +4.5%, SND +5.9%, CRR +3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 6 Comments
  • SHEN

    Shentel notes weakness in accounting controls tied to nTelos deal

    • Shenandoah Telecommunications (SHEN +2.1%) says in its annual report that it's "identified material weaknesses" in controls over financial reporting, though it expects remediation this year.
    • The company says it's concluded that "internal control over financial reporting was ineffective" as of Dec. 31, related to accounting for "significant, complex and unusual transactions, accounting for income taxes, and the preparation of the consolidated statements of cash flows."
    • That means primarily last spring's acquisition of nTelos and the subsequent asset exchange with Sprint.
    • It's making changes to address the weaknesses.
    • Among more standard risks, the company took on substantial additional indebtedness in the nTelos deal, along with nTelos' underfunded defined-benefit pension plan.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • NVO

    European advisory committee backs Novo's hemophilia drug Refixia; shares ahead 2%

    • Novo Nordisk (NVO +1.9%) follows through on its premarket move stoked by a positive opinion from the EMA's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) recommending approval of Refixia (nonacog beta pegol, N9-GP) for the prophylaxis and on-demand treatment of bleeding in patients with hemophilia B.
    • A final decision from the European Commission usually takes ~60 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • TSG

    Amaya higher after CEO tips M&A interest

    • Amaya (AYA) is open to acquisitions in general, CEO Rafi Ashkenazi tells The Montreal Gazette in an interview.
    • "2017 will also be to a large extent the continuing transitional year for us, but probably from the second half of this year, I can be much more focused on finding ways to grow the company, not necessarily organically," says Ashkenazi.
    • The company is looking to hire a M&A specialist to focus on a sports betting deal.
    • Shares of Amaya are up 2.58% in early trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM | 4 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop in the spotlight after earnings

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME) is sized up by Wall Street after reporting holiday sales were ravaged by promotions within the industry. Not a complete surprise, but the company expects to close between 2% and 3% of its stores this year.
    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch (Neutral): Downgrades the retailer to Neutral from Buy as it considers the weak software lineup for this year. An increase in share buyback activity isn't anticipated.
    • Wedbush (Outperform, $25 PT): "We expect shares to trade at a compressed EPS multiple until GameStop slows the decline in its core video game business."
    • Baird (Outperform, $24 PT): Advises that "long-term/value-oriented" might be interested in buying on the pullback.
    • Telsey Advisory (Buy, $24 PT): Notes the FY18 EPS forecast is back-half weighted due to the timing of new software, hardware and iPhone 8 launch.
    • Macquarie: "Our concerns for 2017 are primarily with the video game side with GameStop's collectibles and mobile businesses progressing at a solid pace."
    • Sources: Business Insider, Bloomberg and StreetInsider.
    • GameStop is down 12.15% premarket to $21.05 vs. a 52-week trading range of $20.10 to $33.72.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 4 Comments
  • NVO

    European advisory committee backs label update for Novo's Tresiba; shares ahead 2% premarket

    • The European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) adopts a positive opinion recommending the addition of data from the SWITCH 1 and SWITCH 2 clinical trials to the label of Novo Nordisk's (NYSE:NVO) Tresiba (insulin degludec).
    • A final decision from the European Commission usually takes ~60 days.
    • Previously: Novo Nordisk files application in Europe to include updated trial data in Tresiba label (Nov. 10, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • MDGS

    Medigus prices equity offering; shares down 28% premarket

    • Ultra-thinly traded nano cap Medigus Ltd. (NASDAQ:MDGS) is off 28% premarket on increased volume in response to the pricing of its best efforts public offering of 979,714 Class A Units at $3.50 and 1,163,144 Class B Units at $3.50.
    • Each Class A Unit consists of one American Depositary Share (ADS) and one five-year Series A warrant to purchase one ADS at $3.50.
    • Each Class B Unit consists of one pre-funded warrant to purchase one ADS at $0.01 and one Series A warrant.
    • Gross proceeds should be ~$7.5M. Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.
    • Yesterday's close was $4.41.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am

    • XENE -47% on XEN801 failing to beat placebo.
    • MDGS -28% on secondary offering.
    • FINL -15% on Q4 earnings.
    • SPWH -13% Q4 earnings miss.
    • ADPT -11% on NYSE notice for delay in 10-K filing.
    • GME -11% on weak outlook.
    • CDOR -7% on secondary offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am

    • HTGM +69%, continues winning streak after receiving CE Mark certification for genetic lung cancer test.
    • ZAIS +60% on Q4 earnings.
    • VSTM +17% on FY earnings.
    • RGLS +15%.
    • EBIO +15% on progress in advancing key pipeline programs.
    • MU +13% on FQ2 earnings.
    • SEAS +13% on 21% stake being sold at $23/share.
    • NVCN +13% on Q4 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 3 Comments
  • SESN

    Eleven Bio advancing pipeline; shares ahead 15% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Eleven Biotherapeutics (EBIO) is up 15% premarket on increased volume stoked by encouraging progress in advancing key pipeline programs. Management updated investors this morning during its Q4 conference call.
    • Enrollment in a pivotal Phase 3 study assessing Vicinium in high-grade non-muscle invasive bladder cancer should be completed in H2 with top-line data expected in 2018.
    • A Phase 1/2a study evaluating Proxinium, in combination with a checkpoint inhibitor, in late-stage squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck will be initiated in H2.
    • IND expected to filed next year for systemically-administered TPT, a highly potent, de-immunized plant toxin called deBouganin which may induce an effect against cancer stem cells.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • USCR

    U.S. Concrete CFO Tusa to resign

    • U.S. Concrete (NASDAQ:USCR) says CFO Joseph Tusa, Jr., will resign from the company for "personal reasons," effective July 1.
    • Tusa joined USCR in 2015 after spending seven years as CFO of USA Compression GP.
    • USCR appoints Kevin Kohutek as its principal accounting officer, effective April 1.
    • Also, USCR says it has changed auditors, hiring Ernst & Young as its new independent registered public accounting firm after dismissing Grant Thornton.
    • USCR -2.3% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 12 Comments
  • PTCT

    PTC Therapeutics withdraws European marketing application for Translarna for CF; shares ease 5% premarket

    • PTC Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTCT) is down 5% premarket on light volume on the heels of the withdrawal of its marketing application in Europe seeking approval of Translarna (ataluren) in cystic fibrosis (CF). The action was expected after a failed Phase 3 was announced a few weeks ago.
    • Previously: PTC Therapeutics' ataluren flunks late-stage CF study; shares slump 24% premarket (March 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • FL

    Foot Locker on watch after weak Finish Line report

    • Shares of Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) are down 1.10% after rival Finish Line reported comparable sales fell 4.5% in FQ4 to miss the consensus estimate.
    • Finish Line expects comparable sales to increase at a low single-digit pace this year.
    • Integer Invesments posted an article on Foot Locker yesterday. Included was a breakdown of EV/EBITDA ratios in which Foot Locker compared nicely to Nike, Adidas, VF Corp and Finish Line.
    • Previously: Finish Line lower post FQ4 results (March 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • UA

    Under Armour races higher after rousing Jefferies upgrade

    • Jefferies adds Under Armour (UA, UAA) to its Franchise Picks List on its view that valuation is now at an attractive level.
    • The firm's proprietary survey indicates that demand for athletic apparel is quite solid and that the UA brand has strengthened.
    • "Our revised '18 EPS is 13% above cons., and our webscrapes, store work, and social trend analysis indicate to us an inflection has formed and the buying oppty is now. Our view is compressed valuation and neg. sentiment, ignore compelling growth over the next 2-3 years," writes analyst Randal Konik.
    • Konik takes Under Armour to a Buy rating and lifts the price target to $27 from $19.
    • UAA +4.06% premarket to $19.75. UA +3.33% to $18.02.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 AM | 35 Comments
  • MU

    Micron +13%; sell-side lifts targets post-earnings

    • via Notable Calls
    • Stifel lifts Micron's (NASDAQ:MU) price target to $47, suggesting 77% upside. the team there thinks overall memory demand could continue to outstrip supply throughout the year.
    • Needham outdoes Stifel with a $50 price target. The title of its note: Broad Growth and Content Gains Beats 2014 Cycle.
    • UBS's Stephen Chin likens Micron's beat last night to that of Nvidia's (NASDAQ:NVDA) last October. He reminds Nvidia climbed 30% the next day.
    • Micron +13% to $29.91 premarket; WDC +3.9%, STX +1.2%
    • Previously: Micron Technology +9%; Q3 2017 outlook substantial (March 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 72 Comments
  • SESN

    Eleven Biotherapeutics revenues up 33% in Q4; shares up 9% premarket

    • Eleven Biotherapeutics (EBIO) Q4 results: Revenues: $0.8M (+33.3%); Operating Loss: ($3.6M) (+63.3%); Net Loss: ($3.5M) (+66.0%); Loss Per Share: ($0.15) (+71.7%).
    • 2016 results: Revenues: $30M; Operating Income: $2.9M (+108.2%); Net Income: $1.9M (+105.7%); EPS: $0.09 (+105.1%); Quick Assets: $25.3M (-29.9%).
    • Financial Guidance: Eleven expects to have cash to fund R&D programs and operations into early 2018.
    • Shares are up 9.5% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • M

    Citi delivers harsh assessment of Macy's

    • Citi is far from sold on the turnaround efforts at Macy's (NYSE:M) after taking in the department store operator's tough start to the year.
    • The firm also points to the large number of retail store closings as an indication that the upside for Macy's real estate transactions could be less than some investors anticipate.
    • Shares are downgraded to Neutral from Buy.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Macy's -1.03% premarket to $27.98 vs. a 52-week trading range of $27.83 to $45.41.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM | 13 Comments
  • FINL

    Finish Line lower post FQ4 results

    • Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) reports comparable-store sales fell 4.5% in FQ4.
    • Gross margin rate squeezed 500 bps to 29.1%.
    • SG&A expense rate improved 130 bps to 23.1%.

    Abbott unloads 44M shares of Mylan at ~$40

    • In a block trade of 44M shares at $39.50 - 40.25, Abbott (NYSE:ABT) divests 60% of its remaining stake in Mylan NV (NASDAQ:MYL). The total value of the trade was $1.7B.

  • XENE

    Xenon Pharma's lead dermatology candidate flunks mid-stage acne study

    • Thinly traded micro cap Xenon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:XENE) is poised for a down day after announcing that lead dermatology candidate XEN801 failed to beat placebo in a Phase 2 clinical trial in people with moderate-to-severe acne. Specifically, it failed to demonstrate a statistically valid difference in lesion count from baseline to week 12 compared to placebo. The company will cease development of the candidate for this indication.
    • XEN801 is a topical stearoyl Co-A desaturase-1 (SCD1) inhibitor.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 8:30 am ET to discuss the results.
    • Update: Shares are down 35% premarket on average volume.
